questions.clue: This Moorish general is manipulated by Iago into believing his wife is unfaithful.
This villainous king of Britain is misled by his daughters Goneril and Regan.
Lady Macbeth convinces her husband to murder this Scottish king.
This Duke of Milan usurps his brother's throne in 'The Tempest'.
In 'Richard III', this historical king famously declares he would trade his kingdom for a horse.
For 200 points: This ancient civilization is credited with developing the wheel around 3500 B.C.
For 400 points: Using a system of letters, this ancient culture created one of the first known alphabets around 1000 B.C.
For 600 points: This ancient civilization built an extensive road network, including the Appian Way, completed in 312 B.C.
For 800 points: The implementation of this water-lifting device, used to raise water for irrigation, is attributed to the ancient Egyptians.
For 1000 points: This advanced mathematical concept, first used by the Babylonians, allowed them to calculate planetary cycles with remarkable precision.
Often called the birthplace of jazz, this American city hosts the New Orleans Jazz & Heritage Festival annually.
This Brazilian music genre, blending samba and jazz, was popularized by Antonio Carlos Jobim.
This Swedish pianist and composer, known for his jazz trio, is famous for albums like 'Vagabond' and 'When You Wish Upon A Star'.
Started in 1964, this Dutch city hosts the renowned North Sea Jazz Festival, one of the largest indoor jazz festivals in the world.
This South African jazz trumpeter and bandleader became internationally celebrated for his Afro-jazz sound and hits like 'Grazing in the Grass'.
For $200: This physicist's name is synonymous with the principle that restricts how precisely we can know a particle's position and momentum at the same time.
For $400: This term describes the smallest possible discrete unit of any physical property, such as energy in a photon.
For $600: Albert Einstein used this term meaning 'spooky action at a distance' to describe quantum entanglement.
For $800: This thought experiment features a cat that is simultaneously alive and dead, highlighting the concept of superposition.
For $1000: This complex function provides a probability amplitude for the quantum state of a particle.
This king's legendary court at Camelot is a symbol of chivalric heroism and romance.
This city, said to have been doomed to sink into the sea, has been the subject of countless stories since first mentioned by Plato.
The Iliad, an epic narrative of the Trojan War, was passed down through oral tradition before being attributed to this ancient Greek poet.
In Norse mythology, this world-spanning tree is central to the structure of the universe, encompassing nine realms.
According to Japanese mythology, this sword, one of the three imperial regalia, was found in the body of an eight-headed serpent by the god Susanoo.

final.clue: This city, officially known as Kecamatan Menteng, became its nation's capital in 1949 after the end of colonial rule.
